arts.ttl: Cheltenham Town v Colchester United RECAP: Robins beaten at home
arts.sum: Cheltenham Town were beaten 1-0 at home by Colchester United in League Two on Saturday afternoon. Colchester United: Macey; Egbo, Tucker, Flanagan, Iandolo; McDonnell; Gordon (Anderson 66), Payne (Hunt 90+2), Edwards (Thorn 81); L Taylor (Read 81), Tovide (Simpson 66).

arts.ttl: Harry Anderson gives in-form Colchester victory at Cheltenham
arts.sum: Anderson struck from close range after Ellis Iandolo’s cross from the left and the result extended the U’s’ unbeaten run to 11.

arts.ttl: Kyreece Lisbie scores against former club in Colchester United under-21s defeat
arts.sum: Donovan's attempt was well saved by trialist A but he had no chance as the ball then ran out to Riley Owen, who fired home a shot from the edge of the box to give Brentford the lead, Colchester were still in the game, with Lisbie firing just over the bar and Banjoko headed over after Jolliffe's corner had been headed across goal. Hakeem Sandah's great work on the left paved the way for Lisbie to score at the near post.

Cheltenham's 3-0 defeat to Bradford on Tuesday night ended four games unbeaten and they will be looking to bounce back against Colchester. Colchester's 1-0 win over Chesterfield on Tuesday night was ...

arts.ttl: Simon Keswick divests Cheltenham Town shares to board members in strategic move for future investment
arts.sum: Simon Keswick is in the process of transferring his entire shareholding in Cheltenham Town equally between chairman David Bloxham and director/club secretary Paul Godfrey. A club statement issued on Friday afternoon said: "The transfer is being made to ensure that when a new investor in the club is found the club will be in a position, through David and Paul, to easily transfer Mr Keswick’s shares as may be necessary subject to the terms of any sale or investment agreement."

arts.ttl: Colchester United midfielder Teddy Bishop set for a spell on the sidelines
arts.sum: Cowley said: “We’re hopeful that he’ll be back before the season is out. But the U’s are hopeful that he will be able to return for their League Two season run-in.
